job.title: Senior Hardware Test Engineer
job.description: <p><strong>Position: Senior Hardware Test Engineer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: San Jose CA </strong></p><p><strong>Duration: 3-4 Months Contract</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Pay Rate: $50/hr - $58/hr (depending on experience)</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Relocation Expenses/ Assistance: NO</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Job Description:</strong></p><ul><li>We are looking for a Senior R&amp;D Hardware Test Engineer with strong experience in instrumentation measurements both analog and digital. </li><li>Knowledgeable in PCB test standards, FPGA testing and high-speed board test design. Methodologies of calibration and understanding of measurements uncertainty, six sigma and ICT/DFT/FCT.</li><li>The candidate will work closely with the hardware design teams throughout the product life cycle by defining and specifying test requirements. You will be supporting pre-testing of the Hardware developed by the design teams and supporting the team through product execution, ultimately leading the manufacturing test team to leverage your ATE test platform.</li><li>The ideal candidate must be responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment across multiple projects simultaneously.</li><li>Interface with the R&amp;D designers and other Hardware Engineers to define the most efficient and accurate measurement for testing the boards functionality.</li><li>Design the test fixtures.</li><li>Ability to remotely manage computers using SSH or VNC protocol using Git version control.</li><li>Work closely with validation test engineers to insure that the test fixtures would satisfy module automated testing.</li><li>Drive system verification of solutions through ATE/FCT.</li><li>Support the HW team with sub system bring-up and test fixtures.</li><li>Responsibility for Test definition and calibration of the ATE.</li><li>Collaborate with HW Design Engineers to develop and execute hardware verification test plans.</li><li>Board level functional testing</li><li>Design, build and program test systems used in HW testing as well as generate automated reports tracking for test results.</li><li>Analyze test results and test data to determine if design meets functional and performance specifications.</li><li>Extensive experience in testing of Digital and Analog/Mixed signal circuits</li><li>Experience using RF measurement instruments, high-speed oscilloscopes, signal generators, arbitrary waveform generators.</li><li>Ability to read and interpret PCB schematics and perform basic digital and analog circuit analysis</li><li>Experience designing and analyzing test procedures to minimize measurement error</li><li>Knowledge of industrial controls systems and their communications interfaces and protocols such as Ethernet/IP</li><li>Proficiency with measurement automation tools and scripting languages such as, Python, Labview, Labwindows and Matlab.</li><li>Experience with electronic hardware design tools such as Cadence or Mentor Graphics</li><li>Familiarity and experience working with, Gigabit Ethernet, FPD link, CAN, SPI, I2C, LIN, and RS232.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or similar technical discipline</li><li>MSEE Preferred</li><li>Minimum 5 years of experience as a Test Engineer supporting product introduction.</li></ul><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Desired Skills:</strong></p><ul><li>Ability to install and configure a Linux distribution on desktop (or embedded) systems.</li><li>Familiarity with the pre-built high-performance computing (HPC) software stack used in AMD (Xilinx) devices.</li><li>Comfortable installing pre-built Linux packages, with the occasional build from source.</li><li>Write humble high-level test scripts in Python using pre-compiled software to support that aspirations low-level real-time DSP designers.</li><li>ICT/ FCT</li><li>FPGA BIST, High speed SERDEs, testing I-BERT</li><li>Analog measurements (noise, Jitter, oscilloscope, spectrum, DMM)</li><li>ADC and DAC testing (noise, dynamic range)</li><li>Instrument and test calibration procedures</li><li>GUM analysis</li><li>Six sigma application DFSS</li></ul>
